result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF8, 21CM104, 21CM177 Cash bond conditions modified:  Travel allowed in Oconto and Marinette county to obtain personal property on 6/4, 6/5, 6/11, 6/12 between the hours of 8-5.  Can reside in Iowa upon filing of Waiver of Extradition.  Deft. to notify Oconto Co. Sheriff Dept. when he will be traveling to Oconto County.  To remain outside of Oconto Co. other than as listed on bond.  Deft. can travel on 41/141 to and from court and to meet attorney.  Deft. shall not have direct or indirect contact w/MP, KB, DD (home or business), NB and TC or her family.  Maintain 1 mile radius of victims home.  Maintain distance of all listed of 100'.  No weapons.  Must be on bracelet (fee can come out of Deft. bond).  Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.
